Clause: Integrity Short Term Government Fund, "Fund", Integrity Funds Distributor, LLC, "Integrity", Integrity Funds Distributor, LLC, "Fund", Integrity Short Term Government Fund
Label 1-Answer: Integrity Short Term Government Fund, ("fund"); The Integrity Funds, Integrity Funds Distributor, LLC, ("Integrity")

Clause: This Agreement shall continue until January 18, 2022, and thereafter shall continue automatically for successive annual periods ending on January 18th of each year, provided such continuance is specifically approved at least annually by (a) the FundÕs Board of Trustees and (b) a vote of a majority (as defined in the 1940 Act) of the FundÕs Trustees who are not interested persons (as defined in the 1940 Act) of the Fund and who have no direct or indirect financial interest in the operation of the Plan, in this Agreement, or any agreement related to the Plan (the "Qualified Trustees"), by vote cast in person at a meeting called for the purpose of voting on such approval.
This Agreement shall be construed in accordance with the laws of the State of Kansas.

This Agreement is terminable with respect to the Fund, without penalty, (a) on 60 daysÕ written notice, by vote of a majority of the Qualified Trustees or by vote of a majority (as defined in the 1940 Act) of the outstanding voting securities of the Fund or (b) on 90 daysÕ written notice by Integrity.
This Agreement will also terminate automatically in the event of its assignment (as defined in the 1940 Act).

In consideration of the services rendered pursuant to this Agreement, Integrity shall receive the excess, if any, of the sales price, as set forth in the FundÕs Registration Statement, over the net asset value of Shares sold by Integrity, as underwriter.

The Fund shall also furnish Integrity upon request with: (a) annual audits of the FundÕs books and accounts made by independent public accountants regularly retained by the Fund, (b) semi-annual unaudited financial statements pertaining to the Fund, (c) quarterly earnings statements prepared by the Fund, (d) a monthly itemized list of the securities in the portfolio of the Fund, (e) monthly balance sheets as soon as practicable after the end of each month, and (f) from time to time such additional information regarding the FundÕs financial condition as Integrity may reasonably request.
